newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK C.BANK SAYS NO REV REPO TENDER ON TUESDAY.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK C.BANK SAYS NO REV REPO TENDER ON TUESDAY.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) said it would not hold a tender for short-term securities repurchase or reverse repurchase on Tuesday.

"The banking sector is below the minimum reserve required level and the interbank interest rates have been reacting to our activity by an increase, thus we will not hold a tender today," Peter Andresic, head of the Open Market Operation Department, told Reuters.
According to official NBS figures, the banking sector is short of liquidity, with banks' minimum reserve demands fulfilled at 94.2 percent as of Monday, after 94.3 percent the previous day.
Interbank money market rates firmed in early Tuesday activity to about 20.5 percent offer on overnights and 18 percent on six-month terms.
